column2: Develop and implement quality assurance processes and procedures for software development.           Develop and maintain automated testing frameworks to ensure consistent and efficient testing across all products     Conduct performance testing, penetration testing, and other security tests to identify vulnerabilities and areas for improvement     Work closely with software developers and architects to ensure that our products meet the highest standards of software architecture and design     Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of our products, including familiarity with blockchain technology and SQL databases     Monitor and report on quality assurance metrics to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as necessary     As the head of department, you will be responsible for managing a team of software quality testers. Strong leadership skills are essential to effectively manage and motivate your team.     As the head of the department, you should have a strong understanding of security principles and be able to identify potential security risks in the software. You should also be able to develop and implement security testing strategies to ensure the software is secure.     Represent the company in customer forums and ensure confidence in our deliverables.     Be accountable for reviewing and supporting key CSV deliverables - Requirement Specifications, Validation Plan, Test Plan, Traceability Matrix, Test Summary Report, Qualification Scripts and Validation Summary Report     Understanding of implementing projects on SaaS Models     Interact with internal product owners and client users to understand business, functional & non-functional requirements, or improvements for software product.      Review, understand and ensure that the requirements are detailed, un-ambiguous, complete, and testable.     Author and/or review validation test plan, strategy, requirement traceability matrix, validation test summary report for product releases based on project / product requirements.     Accountable for quality testing and release of all product features and product testing documents/artefacts with high quality.     Lead validation and UAT activities and artefacts for client product implementation projects.     Support and liaise with internal QA team for internal and external audits for product/project documents and artefacts.         Quality Assurance Operations:         Knowledge of GxP, GDP, GTP, QA best practices     In depth understanding of the regulatory guidelines for IT systems- primarily FDA, EMA, MHRA and PMDA     In depth understanding of 21 CFR Part 11, EU Annex 11 compliance.     Minimum 10 years experience of the client, internal and regulatory audits     Anchor updates to QMS     Engage in Continual Improvement programs     Coordinates the revision, review, and approval of IT SOPs and other GxP documents     Train resources.         Team and Stakeholder Management Skills:         Client engagement and ability to convince based on RxLogix Best Practices     Ability to manage Stakeholder needs and do multi-tasking     Oversee work of direct reports and cross-train staff on different quality areas     Interview, hire, train, develop and manage employees     Capacity planning and forecasting resource requirements     Performance evaluation and appraisals     Motivating agent for the team and fosters the spirit of teamwork     Coach, mentor and develop staff, including overseeing new employee onboarding and providing career development planning and opportunities     Closely work with clients, project team and product owners to support product releases and implementations             Other Must-have skills:         Well-organized and detailed oriented professional, with strong verbal and written communication skills     Self-motivated with ability to manage, organize and prioritize multiple tasks     Should be able to achieve the optimum balance for Quality vs. Productivity         Requirements         Exposure to Recruitment and Staffing solutions applications.     Should be open for flexible work hours and shifts as per needs.     10+ years of relevant work experience in quality assurance, with a focus on application security, automation, and testing frameworks     Experience with electronic QMS/DMS is a plus.     Experience in Manual execution and ALM Tool based executions.     Experience with training coordination and management     Worked in Agile / Scrum team structure.     Experience in SQL and PLSQL writing.     Experience with blockchain technology and SQL databases

column2: A Lead QA is a pivotal role within the team, focused on overseeing the quality assurance process to ensure software products meet the highest standards of quality before release.      This role involves strategic planning, development of test plans and cases, and leadership over the QA team to maintain quality throughout the software development lifecycle.          Responsibilities          Lead, mentor, and manage a team of QA Engineers, ensuring their professional growth and performance.          Assign tasks, set goals, and conduct performance evaluations for team members.          Develop and maintain the overall QA strategy and testing roadmap.          Collaborate with project managers and development teams to define testing objectives, scope, and deliverables.          Create detailed test plans, test cases, and test data that align with project requirements.          Execute manual and automated tests to validate software functionality, performance, and security.          Identify defects, document issues, and work closely with developers to resolve them.          Monitor and report on testing progress and results to project stakeholders.          Implement and maintain automated testing frameworks and scripts for regression testing and continuous integration.          Identify opportunities to automate repetitive testing tasks and improve efficiency.          Define and enforce QA standards, methodologies, and best practices across the organization.          Continuously evaluate and improve QA processes to enhance product quality and efficiency.          Assess project risks and develop mitigation strategies related to quality and testing.          Prioritize testing efforts based on risk factors and business impact.          Maintain comprehensive documentation of test plans, test cases, test results, and QA processes.          Create and manage test reports and metrics for project stakeholders.          Collaborate with development, product management, and customer support teams to understand project requirements and customer expectations.          Provide regular updates on QA progress and issues to project stakeholders.            Requirements          Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or any related field          Proven experience in software quality assurance and testing, with a minimum of 2-3 years in a QA role          Proficiency in test management tools and test automation frameworks          Strong knowledge of QA methodologies, testing techniques, and industry best practices.          Excellent communication, attention to detail, problem-solving aptitude and bring innovative ideas          Familiar with test and project management tools such as Jira (Prefered)
column11: Product management, Computer science, Project management, Test management, Regression testing, Customer support, Test cases, JIRA, Information technology, Software quality assurance

column2: 1.Performance Testing NFR Strategy: Develop and implement a comprehensive performance testing strategy and roadmap for various projects and applications.    2.Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of performance testers, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure the teams effectiveness and growth.    3.Project Management: Plan, schedule, and manage performance testing projects, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.    4.Client Collaboration: Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to understand performance requirements, objectives, and expectations. Communicate project progress and results effectively.    5.Test Planning: Define performance testing objectives, scope, and success criteria. Develop detailed test plans and test scripts.    6.Test Execution: Oversee the execution of performance tests, including load testing, stress testing, and scalability testing. Analyse test results and identify performance bottlenecks.    7.Performance Tuning: Work closely with development teams to troubleshoot and resolve performance issues. Recommend and implement optimizations to improve system performance.    8.Tools and Technologies: Stay updated on the latest performance testing tools, methodologies, and best practices. Evaluate and recommend tools and technologies to enhance testing processes.    9.Documentation: Create and maintain documentation related to performance testing processes, test results, and recommendations.    10.Work seamlessly with sales and Presales teams to explore further opportunities with the clients and lead the conversations with COPs when needed.
column11: Performance tuning, Stress testing, Load testing, Test scripts, Test strategy, Testing tools, Project management, Test execution, Performance testing, Test planning

column2: Virtual Engineering Services Pvt Ltd , the exclusive development center for VEST, Inc     USA seeks a hands-on Quality Assurance Manager responsible for those activities required to achieve quality standards     This individual will monitor and advise on the performance of the quality management system generating reports on performance measured against set indicators     The QA Manager must also liaise with other managers and staff throughout the organization to ensure that the QA system is functioning properly     Where appropriate, the QA manager will advise on changes, their implementation, and provide training, tools and techniques to enable others to achieve quality           Responsibilities:       Build a culture of quality and unify the company behind quality values.         Promote quality achievement and performance improvement throughout the organization.         Define, develop and deploy a quality assurance strategy/roadmap addressing all aspects of product definition, development, delivery, and support.         Set QA compliance objectives and ensure that targets are achieved.         Prepare regular and ad hoc reporting of quality activities, measures (e.g. KPI), and the progress of goals to share with team members and stakeholders.         Assist in defining testing approaches and test automation strategies in collaboration with agile development leadership.         Establish standards, best practices, and clearly defined quality methods for various staff roles.         Anticipates potential challenges with product release and takes corrective action, escalating as needed, to resolve and achieve commitments.         Manages and responds to quality assurance issues with related groups such as product development, product management, etc.         Analyze quality results and team feedback to identify, sponsor, and implement quality improvement processes working with inter-department teams.         Promote company software automation testing standards to minimize manual testing efforts and to ensure the software quality does not regress.         Supports agile development processes executing within 2-week sprint cycles and across multiple product areas.         Hire, grow, and retain talent responsible to test and certify quality targets.         Identify and deliver relevant quality-related training.       Requirements:       10+ years of experience in working on software quality with prior responsibility for quality assurance management.         Must have a desire for achieving excellence in customer satisfaction, process and product quality and reliability.         High knowledge of QA methodology and tools, software testing processes and best practices.         Deep understanding of different SDLC methodologies, contemporary software quality assurance processes, and automated tools.         Strong analytical skills and experience with implementation and administration of Quality Assurance metrics.         Strong technical skills with test automation and test management tools.         Excellent problem solving, interpersonal communication and project management skills.         Able to mentor and delegate across a diverse, leveraged organization.         Fluent in English and should have strong verbal and written communication skills.         B.Tech in Computer Science, related discipline, Masters preferred.       Work Environment       We have a strong culture of valuing our employees and promoting an autonomous, transparent, and ethical work environment. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.         We at VEST always try to foster an environment that values and respects all individual s strength, perspectives, ideas and ability to meet the needs of our customers globally.         Talented and supportive peers who value your contributions and drive your learning.         Challenging opportunities: Learning happens outside the comfort zone and that is where our team likes to be always pushing the boundaries and growing personally and professionally.         Transparency: An open, honest, and direct communication with co-workers, seniors and even all our senior management is approachable.
column11: project management, software testing, automation testing, test management tool, problem solving, software quality, automation tools, customer satisfaction, written communication, quality assurance, software quality assurance, sdlc process, communication skills

column2: Seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Testing Manager to lead our testing efforts across various projects     The ideal candidate will possess a comprehensive understanding of manual and automated testing methodologies, including API testing, unit testing, and other emerging testing trends     In addition to technical proficiency, the candidate should demonstrate expertise in penetration testing and possess a strong grasp of software development life cycle (SDLC), software testing life cycle (   STLC   ), bug tracking,    Agile    methodologies, and testing metrics     This role requires excellent leadership and communication skills to facilitate bug triage meetings and effectively manage a team of testers                 Requirements:         Proven experience (10 to 15 years) in software testing, with a focus on manual and automated testing methodologies.     In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience in API testing, unit testing, and other relevant testing techniques.     Hands-on expertise in setting up and maintaining automation testing best practices, frameworks, and tools.     Extensive experience in mobile testing, including testing native, hybrid, and web applications across various mobile platforms (iOS, Android).     In-depth knowledge and practical experience with test automation tools such as Selenium, Appium, or similar.     Familiarity with Jira, TFS, Azure DevOps Boards, Asana, Project Planner, or similar project management and tracking tools.     Must be flexible in work timings to accommodate project needs and team collaboration across different time zones.     Proficiency in defining and setting Key Results Areas (KRA) with respect to testing metrics to measure team performance and project success.     Experience in spearheading the pre-sales and response for proposals stage, including understanding client requirements, preparing proposals, and presenting testing solutions.     Strong expertise in penetration testing techniques, tools, and methodologies.     Proficiency in STLC, Agile, SDLC, methodologies, and bug tracking systems.     Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.     Ability to effectively prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines.     Experience in facilitating bug triage meetings and leading cross-functional teams.     Certifications such as ISTQB, CSTE, or similar are a plus.

column2: As a QA Manager, you must have the expertise to ensure that only robust and scalable products hit the market. You must also possess the foresight to track industry trends and weave them into our best practices and feature/product launches. You will be working very closely with and reporting to the Head of Technology at Unstop.         Responsibilities:           Lead and execute all aspects of the software testing process, including test planning, test case development, execution, and defect tracking.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand product requirements and design test strategies and test plans accordingly.         Develop and maintain test cases, test scripts, and test data sets to ensure comprehensive test coverage.         Execute manual and automated test cases to validate software functionality, performance, usability, and security.         Identify, analyze, and document software defects, issues, and risks using defect tracking tools and project management systems.         Work closely with developers to reproduce and troubleshoot reported defects, providing detailed information and necessary steps to reproduce issues.         Continuously improve and optimize the testing process by identifying areas for automation, implementing test automation frameworks, and integrating automated tests into the CI/CD pipeline.         Mentor and provide guidance to junior QA testers, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.         Stay updated with the latest industry trends, tools, and technologies related to software testing, and recommend improvements to the teams testing practices.           Qualifications:           Proven experience as a QA Manager, with    3 to 5 years of experience    in software testing and quality assurance.         Strong knowledge of software testing methodologies, test case development, and defect tracking.         Experience with both manual and automated testing techniques, including test planning, test script development, and execution.         Proficiency in using industry-standard QA tools and frameworks, such as    Selenium, JUnit, TestNG, JIRA, and Confluence.           Hands-on experience with test automation frameworks and tools, such as Selenium WebDriver or similar.         Solid understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies and working experience in an Agile development environment.         Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and experience in integrating automated tests into the deployment process.         Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and identify potential issues and risks.         Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.         A detail-oriented mindset with a strong commitment to delivering high-quality software products.         Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.
column11: Software testing, Manager Quality Assurance, Test scripts, Defect tracking, Project management, Analytical, Test planning, Selenium, Test cases, JIRA

column2: If you are a Release Train Leader (RTL) and looking for career opportunity, Emerson has and exciting offer to you! RTL will lead multiple scrum teams for one of the ongoing software development programs in Emerson.     In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:       Lead and facilitate the Agile Release Train (ART) in planning and delivering program increments.     Manage and optimize the flow of value through the Agile Release Train (ART)     Facilitate ART practices and PI execution, including but not limited to PI readiness, SAFe events and summarize team PI Objectives into ART PI Objectives. column2: IDESLABS PRIVATE LIMITED is looking for CSV Lead - (Computer System Validation Lead) to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey       Develop and maintain computer system validation (CSV) policies, procedures, and documentation in alignment with regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA, EMA, GxP), industry standards (e.g., GAMP), and company quality management systems.      Lead and manage the execution of CSV projects, including risk assessments, validation planning, requirements gathering, testing, documentation, and validation reporting for computerized systems and software applications.      Define validation strategies, methodologies, and validation deliverables for various types of computer systems, including laboratory information management systems (LIMS), electronic data capture (EDC) systems, enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, and quality management systems (QMS).      Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, quality assurance, regulatory affairs, and business stakeholders, to ensure that computer systems and software applications meet user requirements, functional specifications, and compliance standards.      Conduct validation assessments and gap analyses for new or existing computer systems to identify validation gaps, risks, and opportunities for improvement, and develop remediation plans as needed.      Review and approve validation documentation, including validation plans, protocols, test scripts, traceability matrices, and validation reports, to ensure completeness, accuracy, and compliance with regulatory expectations.      Provide CSV guidance, training, and support to project teams, system owners, and validation professionals on validation principles, best practices, and regulatory expectations.      Stay informed about emerging trends, regulatory changes, and industry developments related to CSV, computerized systems, data integrity, and electronic records management, and recommend proactive measures to address evolving requirements.      Participate in regulatory inspections, audits, and assessments related to computer system validation, providing documentation, evidence, and support as needed to demonstrate compliance with regulatory requirements.

column2: Greetings from Thoucentric! We have an opening for QA Manager for us at Thoucentric, Bengaluru. Please share your updated resume along with details of your CCTC, ECTC and Notice Period.? Location - Bangalore? Mode of work  Hybrid Job Summary The AppleCare Digital team is looking for an energetic and dynamic individual with a demonstrated track record in managing Delivery teams and stakeholder management. As Assistant Manager - QA, you will be responsible for the delivery of the Adecco QA team. You will lead a host of processes, projects and be responsible for task execution across the various areas of QA. Key Qualifications ??Experience in both Manual and Automation testing ??Deep understanding of software QA methodologies & practices ??Hands on in functional, system and integration tests ??Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with frequent context switching ??Experience with cross device and browser testing is a plus. ??Excellent written and verbal communication skills ??Understanding of Client/Server Architecture ??Experience working any of the automation frameworks. ??Detail-oriented, analytical, methodical and creative thinker committed to driving quality forward Responsibilities ??Accountable for resource planning and delegation of work within team? ??Develop functional knowledge of all processes. ??Create and maintain a schedule for all initiatives and drive completion of tasks by the agreed deadlines ??Plan ahead and communicate project/task status in a timely manner ??Work with the team to document all processes and tools as needed ??Conduct monthly reviews with stakeholders ??Ensure processes are effective and maximize shared and re-usable resources ??Accountable for performance management of individual team members ??Support and guide team members ??Actively build the team - hiring, retention, training, and developing team members. Education MBA with a minimum of 10 years experience in Digital Operations and QA with at least 2 years as a people manager managing teams. ?About us Thoucentric is the Consulting arm of Xoriant, a prominent digital engineering services company with 5000+ employees. We are headquartered in Bangalore with presence across multiple locations in India, US, UK, Singapore & Australia Globally. As the Consulting business of Xoriant, We help clients with Business Consulting, Program & Project Management, Digital Transformation, Product Management, Process & Technology Solutioning and Execution including Analytics & Emerging Tech areas cutting across functional areas such as Supply Chain, Finance & HR, Sales & Distribution across US, UK, Singapore and Australia. Our unique consulting framework allows us to focus on execution rather than pure advisory. We are working closely with marquee names in the global consumer & packaged goods (CPG) industry, new age tech and start-up ecosystem. Xoriant (Parent entity) started in 1990 and is a Sunnyvale, CA headquartered digital engineering firm with offices in the USA, Europe, and Asia. Xoriant is backed by ChrysCapital, a leading private equity firm. Our strengths are now combined with Xoriants capabilities in AI & Data, cloud, security and operations services proven for 30 years. We have been certified as "Great Place to Work" by AIM and have been ranked as "50 Best Firms for Data Scientists to Work For". We have an experienced consulting team of over 500+ world-class business and technology consultants based across six global locations, supporting clients through their expert insights, entrepreneurial approach and focus on delivery excellence. We have also built point solutions and products through Thoucentric labs using AI/ML in the supply chain space. Thanks, Debika Roy  debikaroy@thoucentric.com    www.thoucentric.com

column1: Quality Manager - Lithium-ion Battery For Electric Vehicles (EV)
column2: As a Quality Manager in the Lithium-ion Battery Industry, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the highest standards of quality and safety in our battery manufacturing processes. You will lead quality assurance initiatives, oversee regulatory compliance, and drive continuous improvement efforts to enhance product reliability and customer satisfaction. Your expertise will be critical in maintaining our position as a leader in the rapidly evolving battery industry. Responsibilities: Develop and implement quality management systems specifically tailored to the lithium-ion battery manufacturing process, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Lead quality assurance activities throughout the battery production lifecycle, including incoming materials inspection, manufacturing processes, and final product testing. Establish and maintain rigorous quality control measures to monitor critical parameters and ensure the consistency and reliability of battery performance. Conduct regular audits and assessments to evaluate adherence to quality standards, identify areas for improvement, and implement corrective actions as necessary. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including R&D, engineering, operations, and supply chain, to address quality-related issues and drive continuous improvement initiatives. Analyze quality data and metrics to track performance trends, identify root causes of defects or failures, and implement preventive measures to mitigate future risks. Develop and deliver training programs to educate employees on quality standards, best practices, and safety protocols relevant to lithium-ion battery manufacturing. Stay updated on industry trends, technological advancements, and regulatory changes related to lithium-ion battery manufacturing, and ensure that our quality management systems remain current and effective. Establish and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including customers, suppliers, and regulatory agencies, to foster a culture of quality excellence and trust. Drive a culture of quality consciousness and accountability throughout the organization, emphasizing the importance of quality in all aspects of our operations. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in engineering, materials science, chemistry, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. 10 years of experience in quality management, preferably in the lithium-ion battery industry or a related field. In-depth knowledge of lithium-ion battery manufacturing processes, quality standards (e.g., ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001), and regulatory requirements (e.g., UN38.3, IEC 62133). Familiarity with quality tools and methodologies, such as Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA), Statistical Process Control (SPC), and Design of Experiments (DOE). Strong leadership and project management skills, with the ability to drive cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail and a systematic approach to quality management. Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey complex technical information to diverse audiences. Certification as a Quality Engineer (CQE) or Six Sigma Black Belt (CSSBB) is a plus.   How To Apply? Copy and Paste the below link in your browser to apply online on The Search House : https://recruitcrm.io/apply/17139384660260030302Uxv
column11: Quality, Lithium-ion Battery, ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001, UN38.3, IEC 62133

column2: We are looking for a test automation expert, not just someone who can create automated tests for a project. You will need to evolve and own the test automation practice within Kerv Digital, developing an organisational automation strategy that can be put in place across multiple client projects which incorporates best practice, consistency in approach, efficiency and quality. From there you will work with your direct reports to develop a reusable, core Framework as the basis for all we do.               You are passionate about quality and achieving great outcomes for our customers, with a specific talent and enthusiasm for test automation.                  You will be familiar with a wide range of test automation tools, scripting languages, framework practices and you keep yourself familiar with emerging technologies and approaches that will keep you, Kerv Digital and our clients at the cutting edge of technology.                 You will be deployed onto client projects to provide expertise in test automation, delivering our service and you will also oversee that best practice and quality is being delivered by our entire test automation team members on the projects on which they work.                  As well as having a highly technical capability, you must be able to communicate clearly and concisely, verbally and in writing, with a variety of audiences that may or may not have a technical background or understanding and be able to influence and drive change where it is required.                  Proven experience in Microsoft Dynamics and Power Platform solutions and creating test automation for them, would be highly desirable as this is a major part of the Kerv Digital offering.                 The majority of our QA team is India based, with the majority of our client projects and stakeholders in the UK.                   Required Experience:                        Highly experienced Automation Test Manager, who brings a wealth of QA and automation experience                 12+ years experience in QA and test with at least 6+ years in test automation and automation management                 Demonstratable knowledge of the What we are Looking For criteria                             Experience working across multiple concurrent projects                 Proven experience of the following:                         Developing automation strategy and frameworks                 Putting in place and enforcing best practice across teams                 Supporting growth within a team                 Improving ways of working                 Identifying and addressing skills, knowledge and process gaps                 identifying issues and trends in automation degradation                 Owning specific improvement initiatives                 Measuring outcomes                         Maintain and improve QA process, procedures and tooling to ensure that the team are able to deliver great quality software to each of our clients                 Experience managing QA activities across multiple workstreams leading, prioritising, escalating, supporting, coaching and mentoring                 Ensuring quality standards are met across projects                 Identify (and rectify) projects that are turning from Green to Amber (at the earliest stage) - through data and 121s with QA team members                 Able to deep dive into projects, including:                         Supporting the team, and lifting morale if required                 Addressing blocking issues                 Getting stuck into the detail (when required)                 Able to understand (and resolve) broader and more holistic issues that may be causing an impact                         Lead, mentor and nurture a high performing team, with the ability to create training materials and deliver training to various audiences, internally and for our clients                 Ability to create a training programme to develop manual QA team members into Automation Engineers                             Provide strong technology leadership to deliver high quality projects on time and within budget                 Demonstrate high level of interpersonal skills and gravitas                  Pre-sales engagement including testing strategy, tooling and other early opportunity activities such as bid-response writing                 Strong stakeholder management skills                 Experience reviewing and continuously improving testing practises and processes                 Understanding key QA metrics, ability to articulate risk, and provide clear and concise reporting to internal and external stakeholders                 Liaising with Project Managers, Delivery Managers, Developers, Solution Architects, external stakeholders, including external Test Leads and Managers                       Desirable Experience:                        Microsoft Dynamics & Power Platforms                 ISTQB Certifications                         We re also looking for people that fit how we work, which is something like;                          Real team player who is a comfortable managing people and building great working relationships with a positive attitude                 happiest working under their own direction, but fully supported when needed                  an obvious attention to detail                  ability to identify and pick up new processes and software platforms quickly                  ability to work effectively with remote teams in India and the UK                 ability to work flexibly to deliver on-time to tight timescales                    ?

Good To Have Skills:Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 7.5 years of experience in functional test planning. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering high-quality testing solutions. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification 15 years of fulltime education

Must have skills : Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance Functional Good to have skills : NA Minimum  5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : to be a graduate Summary :As a Quality Engineering Lead (Test Lead) for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance Functional, you will be responsible for leading a team of quality engineers through multi-disciplinary team planning and ecosystem integration to accelerate delivery and drive quality across the application lifecycle. Your typical day will involve applying business and functional knowledge to develop end-to-end testing strategies through the use of quality processes and methodologies, and defining and implementing key metrics to manage and assess the testing process including test execution and defect resolution.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead a team of quality engineers through multi-disciplinary team planning and ecosystem integration to accelerate delivery and drive quality across the application lifecycle. Develop end-to-end testing strategies through the use of quality processes and methodologies. Define and implement key metrics to manage and assess the testing process including test execution and defect resolution. Apply testing methodologies, principles and processes to ensure high quality of the product. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure quality of the product. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Strong experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance Functional. Good To Have Skills:Experience in quality processes and methodologies. Experience in defining and implementing key metrics to manage and assess the testing process including test execution and defect resolution. Experience in testing methodologies, principles and processes to ensure high quality of the product. Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure quality of the product. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance Functional. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering high-quality products. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification to be a graduate

Your typical day will involve developing end-to-end testing strategies, applying testing methodologies, principles, and processes, and defining and implementing key metrics to manage and assess the testing process.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead a team of quality engineers through multi-disciplinary team planning and ecosystem integration to accelerate delivery and drive quality across the application lifecycle. Develop end-to-end testing strategies through the use of quality processes and methodologies. Apply testing methodologies, principles, and processes to define and implement key metrics to manage and assess the testing process including test execution and defect resolution. column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for QA Automation Java Selenium to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.As a QA Automation Engineer specializing in Java and Selenium, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of software applications through the design and implementation of automated test scripts. Your responsibilities include collaborating with development and testing teams, creating test frameworks, and conducting automated testing to identify and report software defects.Responsibilities : Test Automation Development : Develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts using Java and Selenium WebDriver.     Design and implement robust test frameworks to ensure efficient and scalable test automation.Test Planning and Strategy : Contribute to the development of test plans, strategies, and test cases based on project requirements.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand application functionality and requirements.Regression Testing : Perform regression testing to ensure the stability of existing features following software changes or updates.Automate repetitive and critical test scenarios for continuous regression testing.Integration Testing : Design and execute automated integration tests to verify the seamless interaction between different components of the application.Defect Identification and Reporting : Identify, document, and report software defects in a clear and detailed manner.     Work closely with developers to troubleshoot and resolve issues.Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) : Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines for timely and reliable test execution.Collaborate with DevOps teams to ensure automated testing aligns with deployment processes.Performance Testing : Collaborate on the design and implementation of automated performance and load tests using appropriate tools.Identify and report performance bottlenecks and areas for improvement.Documentation : Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for test scripts, test frameworks, and testing processes.     Contribute to the documentation of best practices for test automation.Collaboration : Collaborate effectively with QA engineers, developers, and other stakeholders to ensure comprehensive test coverage.Participate in regular team meetings and contribute to the overall improvement of testing processes.Stay Current with Industry Trends : Stay informed about the latest trends, tools, and methodologies in QA automation and software testing.Implement new technologies and approaches to enhance the efficiency of automated testing.

column2: We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.   RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop detailed test plan/ test scripts for all product releases including main releases and hot/ patch fixes. The execution of all test scripts and end user experience tests. Help with the recreation and validation of customer reported issues. Updating test scripts with valid customer reported issues. Managing and maintaining testing-  related documentation,  including test plans,  test cases/ scripts,  and bug reports. Tracking problems and communicating defects to developers as they occur. Provide proactive software quality assurance process assistance. REQUIREMENTS: 4+ years of professional software quality engineering and testing experience,  including test automation and at least 1+ year of experience as a software quality assurance team lead. Experience with client-  server,  web applications,  database solutions,  user interface and infrastructure automation. Experience in SQL,  Agile Processes and testing web services (REST/ SOAP) and other integrations between systems. Experience in testing web-  based and client-  server applications. Experience working in an Agile Development environment. Experience in writing clear,  concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases. Experience working in an Agile/ Scrum development process. Have experience of using tools,  i.e. Rally,  Selenium,  Load Runner,  Keynote and Unified Functional Testing (UFT) to perform functional,  automated,  load,  performance,  and/ or stress testing. Having knowledge of the appropriate programming languages in .Net Framework (REST and/  API,  Web Services) /  tools /  skillsets and high level knowledge of the technical architecture of the project. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Bachelor s Degree in Information Technology,  Computer Science,  (or) Equivalent Degree.

column1: Salesforce QA Consultant / Senior QA Consultant
column2: we're looking for a Quality Assurance professional with a passion for delivering high quality to our customers. You will be responsible for testing applications built on the Salesforce platform which includes core cloud, Heroku and Marketing Cloud.      Under this job role, we are looking for someone with exposure to quality engineering frameworks, and hands-on testing experience on the different Salesforce clouds, Integration and Data Management          Responsibilities    :                Collaborate with client stakeholders to define requirements, deliverables, set and manage expectations      Requirement Analysis, Test Effort estimation, Test Design, Test execution, Defect Management and Test reporting      Provide a practical approach to complex testing, specifically in the areas of the automation of test cases for the purposes of regression testing.      Familiar with source code, version management, and code deployment standards. Ensure that QA processes and procedures for test environments are followed and that the integrity of the various environments are not compromised.      Ensure adherence to standardized QA policies, processes and documentation standards.      Help define test cases. Test case reviews during projects to ensure quality and appropriate design patterns are followed      Maintain a target billable utilization aligned to the role      Liaise with Salesforce product teams to support client implementations      Working remotely, while collaborating with global teams for delivery across geographies. We may need you to be flexible with your work hours      Interact, communicate and follow through with development & customer teams throughout testing phase      Ability to adapt to customer processes and integrate them into day to day work as needed without compromising best practices and quality      Assist in internal defect triage calls      Assist customer with UAT testing as needed      Assist with UAT defect triage calls            Requirements            Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. column2: We are seeking a highly experienced Quality Assurance (QA) Manager with over 13 years of expertise, particularly in Java and Selenium automation. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in software testing methodologies, team management, and automation frameworks. As a QA Manager, you will be responsible for leading and coordinating QA efforts across multiple projects, ensuring the delivery of high-quality software products.           Responsibilities:              Leadership and Team Management: Lead and mentor a team of QA engineers, providing guidance, support, and professional development opportunities. Foster a collaborative and high-performance culture within the QA team. Delegate tasks effectively and ensure timely delivery of QA activities.              Quality Assurance Strategy: Develop and implement QA strategies, policies, and procedures to ensure efficient and effective testing processes. Define testing standards and best practices, incorporating industry trends and emerging technologies. Establish metrics and KPIs to measure and improve the quality of software products.              Test Planning and Execution: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and define test plans. Oversee the creation and execution of test cases, including manual and automated testing. Monitor test results and identify areas for improvement, driving continuous quality enhancements.              Automation Expertise: Utilize Java and Selenium automation frameworks to design and implement scalable and maintainable automated test suites. Evaluate and select appropriate automation tools and technologies to support QA objectives. Conduct code reviews and provide technical guidance to automation engineers.              Risk Management: Identify potential risks and dependencies early in the software development lifecycle. Work closely with stakeholders to prioritize and mitigate risks effectively. Implement robust regression testing strategies to ensure product stability and reliability.              Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of industry trends, tools, and methodologies related to QA and automation. Drive initiatives for process improvement, automation optimization, and efficiency gains. Champion a culture of innovation and quality excellence within the organization.              Qualifications:              Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.              Over 13 years of experience in software quality assurance, with a focus on automation testing.              Strong proficiency in Java programming language and Selenium WebDriver. Proven track record of successfully managing QA teams and delivering high-quality software products.              In-depth knowledge of software testing principles, methodologies, and tools. Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.              Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and stakeholders.             Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. Relevant certifications (e.g., ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus.

Expertise in stakeholder management to prevent any risk, proactively identifying and addressing potential issues to ensure project success and stakeholder satisfaction Lead the design and implementation of automated testing solutions for web, mobile, and API projects, utilizing frameworks such as TestNG, Page Object Model, Keyword Defined Framework, and Hybrid. Manage the release process including generating release packages and coordinating release deployments Lead Go-Live activities, including deployment planning and execution, and collaborate with business users during post-production verification testing (PVT). Define and govern centralized test repositories using tools like Confluence to organize and manage test assets effectively. Architect innovative test strategies and frameworks tailored to agile product engineering environments, focusing on high-risk areas. Interact with client teams to identify project risks, prepare governance reports, and present updates to key internal and client stakeholders. Take overall responsibility for the quality of testing and drive test improvement initiatives across projects. Conduct defect root cause analysis (RCA) and establish quality benchmarks to drive continuous improvement. Proactively engage with clients, conduct weekly deliverables, lead client demos, and track project milestones to ensure client satisfaction. Measure and implement metrics for project performance, ensuring adherence to onsite-offshore processes and agreed timelines. Demonstrate knowledge of DevOps principles and practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and infrastructure automation. Define automation API for the project and demonstrate the benefits to the client, showcasing how automation can improve efficiency, reduce time-to-market, and enhance overall product quality Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field; Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 12+ years of overall experience with at least 5+ years in a Project Manager or Delivery Manager role. Relevant certifications such as PMP, PMI-ACP, CSM, or SAFe are a plus. Strong experience in leading large teams for both manual and automation testing within the insurance industry. Proficiency in Agile methodologies (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) and the ability to define end-to-end QA strategies using automation. Hands-on experience with automation frameworks (e.g., TestNG, Selenium, Appium) and programming/scripting languages such as Java. Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills. Proactive approach to client engagement and a track record of successful project delivery. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on continuous improvement.

column2: As a Quality Assurance Manager specializing in automation testing, you will lead our QA team in designing, implementing, and executing automated testing strategies to guarantee the quality of our software products. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Proven ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects and deadlines effectively.

column2: Principal QA Architect       At Skillsoft, we are all about making work matter. We believe every team member has the potential to be AMAZING. We are bold, sharp, driven and most of all, real. Join us in our quest to democratize learning and help individuals unleash their edge.      OVERVIEW:     The QA Architect is a senior position responsible for the Software Quality Engineering team. We are looking for an experienced, confident professional with high energy, excellent communication and analytical skills and strong personal drive to succeed.      OPPORTUNITY HIGHLIGHTS:       Leading Quality Assurance initiatives, defining and implementing testing processes, resource planning and estimation         Develop test strategies for functional non-functional testing and provide testing support for sprint teams as needed         Provide guidance and mentorship for QA engineers across the organization         Coordinate end to end test coverage with different teams across locations         Oversee ensure the quality of test plans, test cases, test matrix, and bug reporting         Establish design principles for test automation and Performance Testing and recommendations as needed         Design and build scaling test automation frameworks         Build automated test coverage for critical functional areas under test         Work with DevOps team to ensure that the testing strategy is tightly integrated into automated build pipelines         Contribute to managing of test environments         Communicate test progress and test results        SKILLS QUALIFICATIONS:       Successful track record as a hands on leader within QA teams, building and managing teams to a level of top-notch professionals         Strong knowledge of QA methodology and tools. Experienced in defining End to End Test Strategy         Demonstrated experience in Automation test framework design and development         Experience integrating test automation with CD build pipelines         Experience in Performance Testing using open source tools like JMeter, Locust         Experience influencing software engineering best practices within the teams         Experienced in Agile or Scrum software development methodologies         Ability to juggle multiple projects in a high-velocity environment         Experience with multi-stakeholder management - Product management, engineering scrum teams, DevOps, CloudOps, IT, business stakeholders         Working experience with multi-geography engineering / scrum teams         The ideal candidate will have excellent English communication skills, proven leadership skills, software development experience, deep understanding of formal QA tools, methodology/processes

column2: We are looking for a Specialist II- Test Manager to join our FLGS SAP Platforms team in Novo Nordisk. If you are passionate about testing and have a keen eye for detail, then this could be the perfect opportunity for you. Read on and apply today for a life-changing career.                           ?             The position                     Define and implement the test strategy, including roadmap and tools, by coordinating between S4 Hana, Supply chain, and System management teams. Ensure test coverage adherence to meet end user requirements by actively participating in product design and identify, implement, and monitor test metrics to measure the quality of deliverables.                     Act as a subject matter expert in testing and provide expertise to diversified projects across business units and continuously improve testing processes and mentor testers to enhance their capabilities. Stay updated with the latest technology and trends in testing and suggest improvements to onboard IT systems to new technologies.                     Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and create automated test cases. Drive test automation activities and ensure agreed prioritizations and timelines are met. Work closely with the release manager to optimize releases. Manage budget, if applicable and participate in audits related to the supported project.                     Collaborate with SAP FI/BTP System Managers for platform topics and follow compliance requirements, maintain up-to-date documentation, and be audit ready.                     Organize and monitor the defect management process, handle changes, and conduct manual/automated regression tests and spearhead automation testing tasks, including planning, effort estimation, identifying test scenarios, and execution. Prepare software defect tracking and report the entire project release status to stakeholders.                     Qualifications                     You hold a Masters/bachelors with 10+ years of experience working in a service level-based organization/ pharmaceutical industry preferably in the Automation Testing domain. Preferred to have Industry recognized ITIL and ISO quality management certification.                     Minimum 3+ years of practical experience with test automation tools such as Tricentis/Tosca.                     Good understanding of SAP knowhow and SAP Testing knowhow.                     Experience with test automation tools.                     Experience working with test management tools like TIMS, Jira.                     Experience with both waterfall and Agile methodology.                     Excellent communication skills in English and comfortable working with different cultures.                      Ability to collaborate and communicate with stakeholders, both internal and external at all levels.

column2: About CheQ CheQ is a fintech startup, the newest & noisiest on the block! We aim to help customers understand, manage and leverage credit in ways that augment their lifestyle choices. And while doing that, make the experience fun and rewarding. Founded by  Aditya Soni , CheQ has raised $10 Mn in seed funding led by marquee investors like Venture Highway, 3one4 Capital, Multiply Ventures, Marshot Ventures and Veda VC. We are also backed by angel investors like Naveen Kukreja (CEO, PaisaBazar), Shailaz Nag (Founder & CEO, Dotpe) among others.    What youll be doing We are much more than our job descriptions, but here is where you will begin: As a QA Lead, you will be responsible for the quality and reliability of the product. You will be the point person to discuss changes with development and/or product teams, implement systems to test product flows, perform gap analysis and plan to improve the test coverage on a sprint basis. Map Manual Test cases to automation and ensure 100% test automation across all sprints for new work. Building a testing framework and defining testing parameters based on inputs from the product team. Working with cross functional teams to ensure quality throughout the SDLC Drive Customer centricity based testing approach and also meet the fast paced organisational requirements.  Developing multiple test cases and creating appropriate testing environments for checking a product Drive the QA aspect of sprint for the respective teams, and help mitigate any risks proactively that may impact the committed sprint velocity Create and Review Test metrics (# of defects, slippages, etc.) on a regular basis and provide measures / plan to improve upon the product quality. Involved in different types of functional (UI, Database,API) and non functional (Performance & Security) testing using various frameworks, automation tools & technologies. Evaluate different test automation tools and help in streamlining. Guide the team on automation choosing of test scenarios, creating automation scripts, reviewing scripts etc. What you??l need Like us, you??l be deeply committed to delivering impactful outcomes for customers. 8+years of hands-on experience with Integration, Performance and functional testing, test planning, test designing for systems. QA delivery experience preferably from a consumer tech background Ability to perform E2E testing with hands on knowledge about how BE and FE interacts and uphold the QA delivery at high level Hands-on experience with bug tracking tools like JIRA, test management tools like JIRA, testlink, zephyr etc. Ability to manage all aspects of QA life cycle and bring in best practices across disciplines like functional testing, automation testing, performance testing, user interface testing, security testing etc Why should you join CheQ You define your work We acknowledge that your work does not define you. Its you who will define your work here. We do not encourage trade-offs between work and life. Propelled by courage & care We dare each other with the art of possible and then watch each others back delivering the solution with speed, agility, heart and rigor. Learn with the best With a strong leadership team from diverse backgrounds, you can expect to get the best of many worlds And much more! Industry competitive compensation. ESOPs of a boat that you must onboard before it becomes a ship. Work on real problems of India that will create Impact at scale. Work with all the jazz and fancy that new and innovative technologies bring. What you will not get We come from a place of honesty. So lets set our expectations right! Predictability of work You will be a spider in the web; we will throw everything at you! Climbing the slow ladder of Career Growth We all love to hop, skip & grow! Bureaucracy and slow decision making What was that again?? Meetings, meetings & only meetings We believe in agility, empowerment and get the work done!

column2: As the Automation Quality Analyst Lead, you will be responsible for leading the automation testing efforts and ensuring the quality and reliability of Customer experience through the implementation and execution of automated testing processes     Your role will involve overseeing a team of automation quality analysts, designing automation frameworks, defining automation strategies, and driving continuous improvement in testing practices     You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to establish testing standards, identify automation opportunities, and deliver high-quality software solutions          Responsibilities:         Leadership and Team Management:         Lead and mentor a team of automation quality analysts, providing guidance, coaching, and support to ensure their professional growth and development.     Define team objectives, priorities, and performance metrics, and monitor progress towards goals. Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement within the team.         Automation Strategy and Framework Design:         Define automation strategies and roadmap in alignment with project goals, timelines, and quality objectives. Evaluate and select appropriate automation tools, frameworks, and technologies based on project requirements.     Design, develop, and maintain scalable and reusable automation frameworks tailored to specific application architectures, technologies, and platforms.         Test Planning and Execution:         Collaborate with project stakeholders to create comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scenarios for automation. Define test coverage criteria and prioritize test cases based on risk and impact analysis.     Oversee the execution of automated tests to verify software functionality, performance, and scalability. Monitor test results, analyze failures, and coordinate with development teams to resolve issues promptly.         Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD):         Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to enable continuous testing and delivery of software updates. column2: A "Full Chip Reliability Lead" is a senior-level position in semiconductor companies responsible for overseeing and ensuring the reliability of entire chip designs.      The job description for this role typically includes the following responsibilities and qualifications:        Responsibilities:            Reliability Strategy:    Develop and implement reliability strategies and methodologies for full-chip designs to ensure long-term functionality, robustness, and quality.        Reliability Analysis:    Perform reliability analysis, including reliability modeling, stress testing, aging simulation, and failure analysis, to identify potential reliability issues and risks.        Risk Assessment:    Evaluate reliability risks associated with different design elements, technologies, and environmental factors, and develop mitigation plans to address identified risks.        Reliability Testing:    Define and execute reliability testing plans, including accelerated life testing, environmental testing, and reliability characterization, to validate chip reliability under various operating conditions.        Failure Mode Analysis:    Conduct failure mode analysis and root cause analysis for reliability failures, collaborate with design and test teams to implement corrective actions, and drive continuous improvement in chip reliability.        Standard Compliance:    Ensure compliance with industry standards, specifications, and reliability requirements related to chip reliability, such as JEDEC standards, ISO standards, and customer-specific requirements.        Documentation and Reporting:    Maintain documentation of reliability analysis, testing results, failure reports, and corrective actions taken, and provide regular reports and updates to stakeholders on chip reliability status.        Cross-functional Collaboration:    Collaborate with design teams, reliability engineers, test engineers, quality engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate reliability considerations throughout the chip design and development process.          Qualifications:            Education:    Bachelors or Masters degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field, with a focus on reliability engineering or semiconductor reliability.        Experience:    Several years of experience in semiconductor reliability engineering, including experience in a leadership or lead role focused on full-chip reliability.        Reliability Analysis Tools:    Proficiency in using reliability analysis tools and software for reliability modeling, stress testing, aging simulation, and failure analysis.        Testing Skills:    Experience in designing and executing reliability testing plans, including knowledge of accelerated life testing methods, environmental testing protocols, and reliability characterization techniques.        Failure Analysis:    Strong skills in failure mode analysis, root cause analysis, and corrective action implementation for reliability issues. column2: ?         The Senior Team Coach demonstrably helps teams continuously improve their terminology, tools, processes, structure, and culture to create a joyful, ethical, and high-performance environment.      Support teams and value streams in developing a Lean/Agile mindset, including deep respect for people and teams, continuous improvement, economic decision-making, small batches, shortest possible lead times, maintaining quality at appropriately high levels, and minimizing waste.     Facilitate various events within and beyond their teams, creating an environment of openness, safety, and innovation and supporting others in their growth as facilitators.     Create an environment of accountability and attention to results within their teams. Allow the team to remain responsible and leave enforcement of accountability to the teams leadership.     Coach individuals and teams with a thoughtful and creative process that helps them realize their highest potential while honoring and leveraging their inherent creativity, resourcefulness, and wholeness.      Mentor less experienced individuals and teams in a number of related domains, giving feedback without excessive emotional overtone or judgment.     Use modern pedagogical techniques to teach and train individuals and teams in Agile/Lean concepts. Deliver or co-deliver Agile Fundamentals courses based on CSM/PSM-I/ICP core learning objectives. Partner with an Enterprise Coach to identify and capitalize on learning opportunities by developing and delivering new curricula as new topics arise.     Manage their own engagement with their teams and value stream by co-creating inspiring goals and designing alliances between coach and coaches.      Model servant leadership, caring deeply for the growth of those that they support and creating fellow leaders, not followers.     Support teams in their development as complex human systems by championing diversity/equity/inclusion, psychological safety, and constructive conflict resolution.      Accurately assess the health of their teams using new or established frameworks and continuously adapt their teaching, facilitation, mentoring, and coaching accordingly.     Organize and facilitate the launch of new teams, resulting in good starts with a team vision aligned to the value stream and the organizations objectives and key results.     Support their Product Owners with the creation and refinement of their product vision and goals, as well as the translation of those goals into a healthy product backlog using techniques such as user story mapping, innovation games, product data analysis, etc.     Support the broader organization in its Agile adoption, help non-technical people understand complex Agile delivery, and facilitate continuous improvement in the organization in partnership with other coaches to increase the effectiveness of teams.         Here's what you'll bring to the Expert Teams at Episource:          At least ten years of total experience as a leader (Product Owner, Engineering Manager, etc) within software development organizations, preferably in the healthcare industry, including a minimum of five years of experience as a Scrum Master or Agile Coach.      Bachelors (required) or Masters's (preferred) degree in a related field such as computer science, information technology, software engineering, economics, or business administration. Candidates with a demonstrably equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.      At least two years experience remotely coaching Agile teams and stakeholders (required), preferably internationally-distributed teams and stakeholders with diverse cultures and backgrounds.     Superior communication skills especially with customers     Excellent computer proficiency, including proficiency in Google Docs/Sheets/Slides, Slack, and similar productivity tools.     Extensive experience supporting teams and value streams using one or more Agile Lifecycle Management tools, such as Jira, Rally, Digital.ais Agility, Pivotal Tracker, Asana, Shortcut, etc     Certifications a plus examples include: A-CSM or PSM-II, preference for CSP-SP or PSM-III; ICP-ATF and ICP-ACC; and / or LeSS CLP and/or SAFe SPC

Job Summary:  Currently seeking a highly talented EMC Application Manager to join the Customer Success Team in a rapidly growing simulation startup. This position will require technical expertise in assisting the Engineers to succeed in mitigating their electromagnetic compliance to industry standards over Semiconductor, Tier-1, or OEM-level companies.  Roles and Responsibilities  1. Understanding Customer Designs and Schematics  2. Detecting the potential EMC Noise Sources in Customer designs  3. Ability to mitigate component-level EMI/EMC issues  4. Document the requirements or requests from customers to the development team  5. Candidate must be proficient in English, and familiar with MS Office tools.   ??Candidate must be a self-starter with a positive attitude, high ethics, and a track record of working optimally under pressure in a time-constrained environment.   ??Candidate must demonstrate excellent analytical and problem-solving skills   ??Ability to mentor and teach subordinates and partners to accomplish project and departmental goals and objectives. column2: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING          We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry,  our communities,  and the world.  Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences   the building blocks for the data center,  artificial intelligence,  PCs,  gaming and embedded.  Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture.  We push the limits of innovation to solve the world s most important challenges.  We strive for execution excellence while being direct,  humble,  collaborative,  and inclusive of diverse perspectives.          AMD together we advance_                        S    MTS Functional Safety Manager                             THE ROLE:                      As Functional Safety Manager,  part of AMD Functional Safety team,  you will be directly impacting the certification of key AMD products,  targeting critical AMD growth markets such as digital cockpit and autonomous driving.  You will perform this in collaboration with cross functional teams within AMD.   This role will require understanding of safety standards and System/SOC architecture within the automotive and industrial markets also project management skills.   We are seeking an engineer to join our team that will thrive in a fast-paced work environment,  using     effective communication    ,  problem-solving and prioritization skills.  Individuals that are well organized,  show great attention to detail,  and employ critical thinking are well-suited for our team.                                    THE PERSON    :                      Th    is     AMD (Advanced Micro Devices)     team is looking for a senior level person that can help guide the team,  mentor     up    coming developers,      provide     long range strategy,  and is willing to jump in    to help resolve     issues     quickly.  You are open minded and positive as you will be involved in all areas that     impact     the team including    performance    ,      automation,  and dev    elo    p    ment    .             The right candidate will     be    informed on the latest trends and become prepared to give consultative direction     to     senior management. column2: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING          We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry,  our communities,  and the world. Your task will be to provide technical leadership for the product line safety function and for its customers. We are seeking an engineer to join our team that will thrive in a fast-paced work environment,  using     effective communication    ,  problem-solving and prioritization skills.  Individuals that are well organized,  show great attention to detail,  and employ critical thinking are well-suited for our team.
